summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from October to November 2021 between attorneys from WilmerHale (representing JPMorgan) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss scheduling calls and the process of identifying and subpoenaing a JPMorgan witness for Maxwell's trial.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale law firm corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office to arrange meetings and discuss obtaining a trial subpoena for a JPMorgan witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale law firm copied on the email correspondence regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case and the JPMorgan witness.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Individual whom the WilmerHale attorneys wish to set up a call with the prosecution team; mentioned as traveling on specific dates.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York corresponding about trial witness issues and providing a subpoena.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York copied on correspondence about the JPMorgan trial witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the legal correspondence.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at the WilmerHale law firm working together on matters related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case and JPMorgan.
Stoddart (defense/representative counsel) corresponds with AUSA Maurene (prosecution) regarding trial logistics and witness subpoenas.
Stoddart addresses both AUSAs Maurene and Lara in an email regarding obtaining a trial subpoena for a JPMorgan witness.
Stoddart is attempting to arrange a call between the prosecution team and Pat McHugh, suggesting a working relationship.
The WilmerHale attorneys are representing JPMorgan's interests in identifying and providing a witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Jury selection is referenced as being scheduled to be underway in the week following November 9, 2021, for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Call Regarding Trial Witness Topic
events.description: A call is scheduled between WilmerHale attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office to discuss the topic of a trial witness from JPMorgan.

events.title: Subpoena Provided for JPMorgan Witness
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office provides a broadly worded subpoena to JPMorgan to secure a witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007 (WilmerHale office)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: WilmerHale attorneys are acting for JPMorgan in connection with the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial, specifically regarding the identification and subpoena of a JPMorgan trial witness.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York provided a 'broadly worded subpoena' to JPMorgan to secure a witness for the trial.
Jury selection for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to be underway in November 2021.
The correspondence reveals ongoing coordination and scheduling between defense representatives and prosecutors in the lead-up to the Maxwell trial.
